comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

The page https://www.pensioenpage.com/?_indent=true contains an <LI> list items that has a background image instead of the bullet visualization:

   list-style-image: url("/ListBullet_Telefoon.png")

This displays an orange phone icon.

Problem is that sometimes (I needed to shift-refresh about 30 times) the orange phone does not show up, but instead a stretched black bullet symbol was shown.

Reproducible: Sometimes
comments.creator: znerd@FreeBSD.org

The page https://www.pensioenpage.com/?_indent=true contains an <LI> list items that has a background image instead of the bullet visualization:

   list-style-image: url("/ListBullet_Telefoon.png")

This displays an orange phone icon.

Problem is that sometimes (I needed to shift-refresh about 30 times) the orange phone does not show up, but instead a stretched black bullet symbol was shown.

comments.text:
I can't reproduce the problem in 4.0 RC1 on OSX 10.5.8 and Linux.

Do you have Skype installed?
Can you reproduce the problem in Firefox Safe Mode?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

comments.author: znerd@FreeBSD.org
comments.text:
Sorry for not responding sooner. Yes, I can reproduce the issue. And yes, I do have Skype installed.

This is the steps I took:
- I have Firefox 4.0 (final) installed (I installed the RC)
- I did restart in Firefox Safe Mode
- then I went to the URL and reloaded (Cmd-R) it 6 times and then did a Shift-Reload (Shift-Cmd-R) once and I got the issue again
- I made screenshots, which I can append again if necessary.

Note that I'm using Mac OS X 10.6.6.
comments.creator: znerd@FreeBSD.org
